attributes.additional_details: As a TV License payer I do not see on what possible basis the BBC reserve the right to cancel/suspend the remaining 3 episodes of the current Top Gear season. Their apparent dispute with Jeremy Clarkson should not alter the programming schedule as it is extremely unlikely that the alleged fracas/dispute is featured, glamorised or covered within the remaining episodes and therefore should not allow the BBC to use the suspending of the programmes as a form of supposed "punishment" against not only Jeremy Clarkson but the TV license paying public as well!!
